misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that the standard approach used for shifting (saving the last element, then iterating backwards from the last index to index 1, assigning `arr[i] = arr[i-1]`) is the most direct and efficient method for shifting elements in-place while keeping the loop limits tightest (stopping at `i > 0`). This implementation is actually correct and standard for a right shift with wrap-around, leading to a correct solution.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no conceptual gap related to the array manipulation logic. The student correctly identified the need to save the element being displaced (the last element) before starting the shift, iterated backwards to prevent overwriting unshifted values, and handled the wrap-around assignment correctly.
